sn12.39:4.2: “Mendicants, what you intend or plan, and what you have tendencies for become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.39:4.3: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.39:4.4: When consciousness is established, name and form is conceived.
sn12.39:4.5: Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields.
sn12.39:4.6: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
sn12.39:4.7: Contact is a condition for feeling. …
sn12.39:4.13: sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress come to be.
sn12.39:4.14: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.39:5.1: If you don’t intend or plan, but still have tendencies, this becomes a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.39:5.2: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.39:5.3: When consciousness is established, name and form is conceived.
sn12.39:5.4: Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields. …
sn12.39:5.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.39:6.1: If you don’t intend or plan or have tendencies, this doesn’t become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.39:6.2: With no support, consciousness is not established.
sn12.39:6.3: When consciousness is established, name and form is conceived.
sn12.39:6.4: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. …
sn12.39:6.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
